sentences: Tema heas tujus oli terve päev.
Ta tegutses alati oma heade maksimumide järgi.
context: The word 'heas' is an Estonian adverbial form of the adjective 'hea', meaning 'good'. It's used to describe how something is done, indicating quality or manner. In this case, it appears to be in the illative case (motion into), suggesting movement toward a good state or action performed well.
